meanings.definition: A person whose sexual behavior is considered abnormal or unacceptable.
meanings.sent1: The pervert was not welcome in our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The community worked together to keep the pervert away from children.
meanings.sent3: The pervert tried to sneak into the movie theater without a ticket.
meanings.sent4: His twisted mind made him a pervert of human decency.
meanings.sent5: The pervert's actions left a stain on the town's reputation.

meanings.definition: To lead someone away from what is considered right, natural, or acceptable.
meanings.sent1: He tried to pervert her from her honest ways.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was to pervert the hero's sense of justice.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to pervert the dog's loyalty to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic sought to pervert the pure heart of the princess.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's spell aimed to pervert the kingdom's peace.

meanings.sent1: The virus can pervert the computer system if not stopped.
meanings.sent2: The fake news was designed to pervert the truth.
meanings.sent3: The artist's unique style seemed to pervert the traditional painting techniques.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to pervert the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The toxic relationship began to pervert her sense of self-worth.
